alert.note: Alert for Los Angeles County Mountains excluding the Santa Monica Range; Santa Barbara County Mountains; Ventura County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 05 at 5:05PM PST until March 06 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Light to moderate snow expected, with total snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches expected. Accumulations around 1 inch are possible for Interstate 5 near the Tejon Pass. Snow levels between 2500 and 3500 feet. West to north winds 20 to 35 mph with gusts to 50 mph at times. * WHERE...Santa Barbara County Mountains, Ventura County Mountains, and Los Angeles County Mountains excluding the Santa Monica Range. * WHEN...Until 10 AM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Travel delays and road closures are possible, including including Interstate 5 from Castaic to the Grapevine and Highways 2 and 33. Roads may remain icy and impassable well after snowfall has ended overnight into early Sunday. Gusty winds could generate blowing snow with low visibilities at times. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow showers are also possible across the adjacent foothills of the Antelope and Cuyama Valleys through this evening, although accumulations are expected to be minimal. This could impact portions of Highway 166 in the Cuyama Valley and Highway 138 near Neenach.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions from CalTrans are available by calling 1 800 4 2 7 7 6 2 3.

area.areaDesc: Los Angeles County Mountains excluding the Santa Monica Range; Santa Barbara County Mountains; Ventura County Mountains
